arts.ttl: Fermin Lopez sends message to Real Madrid after Bayern win
arts.sum: Lopez then looked ahead to Sunday’s match against Real Madrid and is hoping his team can continue their fine form. The Spain star was back in the starting XI for the game and grabbed two assists on a great night for Hansi Flick’s side.

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich star refuses to rule out move to 'special' Barcelona
arts.sum: "In football you can never rule anything out," Kimmich told the Spanish publication Marca before Bayern's Champions League trip to Barcelona on Wednesday night. When drawn on his precarious contractual status at Bayern, Kimmich warned: "Everyone knows that, what I discuss with the club is something internal and I don't share it with anyone."

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich boss Vincent Kompany: “It just wasn’t possible” to start Jamal Musiala today
arts.sum: Be sure to stay tuned to Bavarian Podcast Works for all of your up to date coverage on Bayern Munich and Germany. Would he be ready for Bayern Munich ’s big clash with FC Barcelona ?

arts.ttl: Hansi Flick praises Bayern Munich’s confidence under Vincent Kompany
arts.sum: Unsurprisingly, Flick took the high road and specifically singled out his counterpart, Vincent Kompany, for the work he’s done in a short time at Bayern. Ironically, Kompany has employed the same high defensive line that Flick also prefers.

arts.ttl: Manuel Neuer calls out Bayern Munich for lack of aggression
arts.sum: “Both teams play a risky game so mistakes and ball losses can happen,” Neuer said (as captured by @iMiaSanMia ). Looking for more thoughts and analysis on how FC Barcelona dismantled Bayern Munich in the Champions League?

arts.ttl: Three talking points from Barcelona 4-1 Bayern
arts.sum: Wednesday night saw Hansi Flick up against his old club, Bayern Munich, for the first time. Ahead of the test against the Bavarian giants, the hosts didn’t need reminding that it was way back in 2015 when they last got the better of Bayern.

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich sporting boss Max Eberl lashes out at reporter following Champions League defeat to FC Barcelona
arts.sum: Top board member for sport Max Eberl, faced with questions over Bayern’s defensive performances, snapped back at the reporter who asked it — as captured by Az journalist Patrick Strasser . Looking for more thoughts and analysis on how FC Barcelona dismantled Bayern Munich in the Champions League?

arts.ttl: Raphinha says Bayern rout 'revenge for the fans'
arts.sum: Barcelona forward Raphinha said Wednesday's thumping 4-1 Champions League win over Bayern Munich served as "revenge" for the club's supporters for past results against the German giants.

arts.ttl: With Bayern crushed, Barça and Raphinha look ominous pre-Clásico
arts.sum: Raphinha proved that he is in career-best form with a hat trick against Bayern Munich. Now, the Clasico awaits.

arts.ttl: Barcelona 4-1 Bayern Munich: Player ratings as Raphinha hat-trick underpins clinical Catalan display
arts.sum: Fermin Lopez played the final ball around the corner to the space in front of Raphinha, although Joshua Kimmich was poorly positioned and then messed up the chance to cut the pass out. It was just their third shot on target of the night but produced a third goal, taking in a cross-field pass from Marc Casado, driving forward, cutting onto his right foot and unleashing an unstoppable strike into the far top corner.
